item.title: Reading Bohm 1
item.description: David Bohm was a strange character whose strangeness has been skimmed off the way his works are now presented. He was not just the theorist of the de Broglie-Bohm pilot-wave, hidden variables interpretation of Quantum Mechanics. (If unclear: this is a silly test post to make sure things look and work all right on the website!)

item.title: Contact
item.description: You can reach me at hsherling @ gmail dot com or come to my office hours any Monday or Wednesday from 16:00 to 17:00 (GMT+00) — if I’m not there, I’ll pop in as soon as I see the email notification that you have joined. I am on Twitter too, though I don’t check it very often.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Here are some things I have worked on lately: Refereed philosophy papers for Dialexicon Journal Translated English psychology articles to Norwegian for Practical Health Psychology At King’s College London: Presented a paper for the PsychSoc journal club Co-organized Philosophy of Mental Disorder Discussion Group with PhilSoc and PsychSoc Co-organized Epistemology of Peer Disagreement Reading Group with PhilSoc Co-organized Alexander Bogdanov Reading Group with PhilSoc Co-wrote Dark Matter and Dark Energy Lecture Notes (2019-2020) 7CCP4935 For St.

item.title: Resumé
item.description: I am currently on the lookout for a job. You can find my work experience and education below. Get in touch if you are interested in working with me. PDF version of my resumé is available here. Last updated: November 15th, 2020. Work experience Product Analyst, curalens.ai (2020-) I analysed therapy transcripts and thence made testing data and classifiers for a machine learning algorithm that will perform mental health assessments.
